First Words

The Mission of Tunza Afr!ka is to provide the spaces, tools and solidarity support for individuals and organizations to answer contemporary challenges.

Learn More

In KiSwahili, 'tunza' means 'to treat with care and affection'. Tunza also invokes us to accept a gift and treat it with dignity, love and respect. If anything goes wrong in that process, then we believe humans are endowed with the wisdom to creatively seek to restore or transform that gift into something even better.

Tunza Afr!ka functions in four interconnected and interdependent programs

Practice (Activities & Processes)

Oliver Mbayi and Philomena Waithira

  1. Workshops and learning processes.
  2. Healing encounters.
  3. Conferences/symposia/festivals.

Research & Publications

Babu Ayindo

  1. Indegenous and decolonizing research.
  2. Publications for all readership including newsletters, books, audio-visual, film.
  3. Mentorship in research and publications.

Mentorship & Leadership Formation

Carolyne Okello and Winnie Orodi

  1. Leadership formation at community and middle level.
  2. Training and mentoring leadership at grassroots level.
  3. Nurturing young leadership in schools and colleges.

Solidarity & Action

Otieno Ombok and Alfred Kibunja

  1. Solidarity action in Kenya and abroad.
  2. Mobilizing resources to support individuals and families in emergency.
  3. Special projects as needs arise.
